verb.description: Make (someone) feel ashamed and foolish by injuring their dignity and self-respect, especially publicly.
examples: you'll humiliate me in front of the whole school!

origin: Mid 16th century (earlier ( late Middle English) as humiliation): from late Latin humiliat- made humble, from the verb humiliare, from humilis (see humble). The original meaning was bring low; the current sense dates from the mid 18th century.
